page.title: 09THORPE'S VILLAGE GREENS
page.content: ACROSS THE ROAD FROM MORLEY COTTAGE, WHERE THE TENDRING ROAD MEETS COLCHESTER ROAD, IS AN OPEN SPACE CALLED FIRST GREEN. IT HAS APPROXIMATELY 15 TREES AND THE GRASS IS CUT FAIRLY REGULARLY SO THAT PEOPLE CAN HAVE PICNICS THERE AND CHILDREN CAN PLAY. ABOUT HALF A MILE DOWN THE ROAD TOWARDS COLCHESTER THERE'S SECOND GREEN WHICH IS AT THE JUNCTION OF WHITEHALL LANE. IT IS MUCH BIGGER THAN FIRST GREEN AND HAS ABOUT 20 TREES AND 3 PONDS, 2 OF WHICH ARE MEDIUM SIZED AND THE THIRD SMALLER. WHEN IT RAINS HEAVILY BOTH GREENS BECOME WATERLOGGED AND IT TAKES 2 TO 4 DAYS FOR THEM TO DRY OUT. BOTH GREENS ARE PUBLIC OPEN SPACES BUT ARE NOT USED VERY MUCH BECAUSE THEY ARE A LONG WAY FROM THE CENTRE OF THE VILLAGE.
